intro: Eriostemon trinervis, commonly known as the narrow-leaved eriostemon, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves with three veins. The plant produces small, fragrant white flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often found in woodland and rainforest habitats, thriving in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value and ecological importance, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
